page.title: 01Tinto Hill
page.content: Tinto hill at 707 metres a.s.l. is the most dominant hill feature in the Lanark area. Its distinctive shape and form is observable from many vantages points in Lanarkshire especially on a clear day. The views from its summit are quite unsurpassed, which makes it popular with hillwalkers. The cairn at its summit is of bronze age origin,about 2000 bc. Nowadays this bears evidence of our modern throw away age, beer and other drink cans,plastic cups and chocolate biscuit wrappers lie amonggst thousands of boulders making up the cairn. Tintos upper slopes are strewn with fragmented bare rock and scree. Thereafter it is dominated by uncultivated moorland and heath with rough grass, heather and blueberry. Much of this is enclosed for sheep to graze upon. Hang gliding has become
